activities.loc: Branch 5 Courthouse and Law Enforcement Center

result.execSummary:
The defendant Carter R Radde was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Probation is concurrent with La Crosse County case 22CF322, with conditions also concurrent
.

miscConds.notes:
Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. 
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing

Def is not to be present at bars or taverns, with exception of employment upon approval of the supervising agent

Def is not to be present at any location where illicit drugs or controlled substances are kept, used, sold or distributed
.

Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by the PO and follow-through with any treatment recommended

Pay restitution and surcharge as shown in 22CF322

Court costs/fees are REMITTED by the Court on this case

Pay DOC Supervision fees(not shown) - to be paid directly to the Dept of Corrections

Credit for 52 days if probation is ever revoked
.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed
Cts 1 & 2 - Def pleads NO CONTEST
Strittmater relies on criminal complaint for factual basis - in compliance w/ victim rights act
CRT finds def's plea is FV&I made - factual basis exists to accept plea - finds def guilty
CRT'S SENTENCE:  Sent w/held;  Probation 2 yrs Concurrent w/ 22CF322, w/ conditions also concurrent:  AODA & follow-thru w/ any trmt recommended;  Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or cont subs w/o valid prescription, w/ random testing;  Def is not to be present at bars or taverns w/ exception of employment upon approval of supervising agent;  Def is not to be present at any location where illicit drugs or cont subs are kept, used, sold or distributed;  Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed approp by the PO & follow thru w/ any trmt recommended;  Pay restitution & rest srchge as shown in 22CF322  Mandatory Crt costs/fees are REMITTED by the CRT on both Cts;  Pay DOC fees - to be paid directly to Dept of Corrections;  Credit for 52 days if probation is ever revoked

Watts - Def agrees with competency 
CRT: finds the Def competent to proceed.  Any cash bonds to be modified to a $1000 sig bond with same conditions and ADD that he be in compliance with the JSS release plan. Def to report to JSS immediately upon release to provide contact information.
